chargeHist.descr: Armed Robbery with Threat of Force
Armed Robbery with Threat of Force

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D. Olsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: to C.K. to be paid out of prison wages.
Maintain FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
No contact with victims, C.K., N.L.L. and C.V.

AODA and follow through.  

Mental health counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by the Department. 

DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 2:00 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears by via Zoom Video from Fox Lake Correctional, pro se.

Date and Time Set for a Hearing regarding Sentence Credit.

COURT recites history of case.
COURT notes defendant does not provide enough information to the court.
ADA Puig makes statement regarding sentence credit. Puts credit on the record. Credit from 7/8/15 to 7/27/17 which is 750 days.
Defendant makes statement.
COURT addresses defendant.
COURT does not give defendant anymore sentence credit.

Adj: 2:10 p.m.
Hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter from deft specifying dates he is requesting be included in sentence credit.
Calendar call on October 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Calendar call on September 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

3:20 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo for ADA Kerri Puig; Defendant appears in custody from the Fox Lake Correctional Institution via Zoom video, pro se.

Date and time set for a Hearing for Sentence Adjustment.

ADA Mayo makes statement regarding motion for sentence credit.
COURT makes statement.
Defendant makes statement. 
ADA Mayo notes there's no dates for sentence credit on the motion.  Asks for more specific motion.
COURT directs defendant to write a letter being more specific on days for sentence credit. 
Defendant makes statement. 
COURT schedules CC.  

CC - 9/21/22 at 1:00 p.m.

ADJ: 3:25 p.m.
Hearing on September 14, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:10 am 
INCLUDES 13CF773, 15CF602, AND 14CM1408. 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Thomas Wilmouth.  
COURT notes review of deft's sentencing memorandum and apology letters. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 13CF773: Ct. 1 (Burglary - Armed with Dangerous Weapon/PTAC/Persistent Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Burglary - Dwelling/PTAC/Persistent Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force/PTAC/Persistent Repeater)>>DISMISS Persistent Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 5 (False Imprisonment/PTAC/Repeater/Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (False Imprisonment/PTAC/Repeater/Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Criminal Damage to Property/PTAC/Repeater/Use of a Dangerous Weapon)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF602: Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force/Persistent Repeater/PTAC)>>DISMISS Persistent Repeater enhancer. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force/Persistent Repeater/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (False Imprisonment/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (False Imprisonment/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 5 (Theft/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 6 (Theft/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 7 (Theft/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 14CM1408: Ct. 1 (Criminal Damage to Property/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 13CF773: Amended Ct. 3 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force/PTAC)>>GUILTY. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Felon Possess Firearm/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF602: Amended Ct. 1 (Armed Robbery with Threat of Force/PTAC)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 13CF773: Ct. 3>>25 years imprisonment - 15 years IC & 10 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: no contact with victims - C.K., N.L.L., and C.V.; pay restitution of $155 to C.K. in 15CF602 to be paid out of prison wages; AODA and follow through; mental health counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 
                    : Ct. 4>>SWH for 5 years probation - CONDITIONS if not already addressed by ES: no contact with victims - C.K., N.L.L., and C.V.; pay restitution of $155 to C.K. in 15CF602 to be paid out of prison wages; AODA and follow through; mental health counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; CC. 
In 15CF602: Ct. 1>>25 years imprisonment - 15 years IC & 10 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: no contact with victims - C.K., N.L.L., and C.V.; pay restitution of $155 to C.K. in 15CF602 to be paid out of prison wages; AODA and follow through; mental health counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. 

COURT ORDERS prison sentences on Ct. 3 in 13CF773 and Ct. 1 in 15CF602 to run CONCURRENT to each other and CONSECUTIVE to probation sentence on Ct. 4 in 13CF773. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 927 days sentence credit on Ct. 3 in 17CF773 and on Ct. 1 in 15CF602.  
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP or SAP. 
COURT remands deft into custody for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 9:53 am
Restitution Order

VICTIM IDENTIFICATION ISSUE.

Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - denies motion. 

OTHER ACTS MOTION.

COURT directs parties to make offer of proof re: other act testimony. 

COURT directs parties to see JA to set another motion hearing date. 

Parties do NOT have an agreement at this time.

INCLUDS 15CF602 & 13CF773 Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.   No contact with victim(s): N.L., M.L., P.H., C.K., C.V., or Little Ceasars-Schofield. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
